statements.name: PROC NESTED
statements.description: The NESTED procedure performs random-effects analysis of variance for data from an experiment with a nested (hierarchical) structure. â€  Note that PROC NESTED is appropriate for models with only classification effects; it does not handle models that contain continuous covariates. For random effects models with covariates, use either the GLM or MIXED procedure.

arguments.name: AOV
arguments.description: Displays only the analysis of variance statistics when there is more than one dependent variable. The "analysis of covariation" statistics are suppressed

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set to be used by PROC NESTED. By default, the procedure uses the most recently created SAS data set.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: You must include a CLASS statement with PROC NESTED specifying the classification variables for the analysis.

arguments.name: TRUNCATE
arguments.description: Specifies that class levels should be determined by using no more than the first 16 characters of the formatted values of CLASS variables.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement lists the dependent variables for the analysis. The dependent variables must be numeric variables. If you do not specify a VAR statement, PROC NESTED performs an analysis of variance for all numeric variables in the data set, except those already specified in the CLASS statement.
